page.title: 07EASTON VILLAGE
page.content: Easton village is part of the Easston hall Estate belonging to Sir Montague Cholmeley. Easton hall, after being taken over by the paratroops(who went to Arnhem) during the second world war, was demolished in 1950 on the decision of his father Sir Hugh Chomlmeley , due to its over-large size and the high cost of repairs. The stone lions At the gate of the Dower House nearby were brought over from the hall.THe village houses are stone built except for two red brick, and together with the well kept gardens, ablaze with old-fashioned flowers such as lupins, peonies, hollyhocks, red hot pockers and irisies, make a most attractive scene. Though they are not owner occupied, the Dwellings are obviously maintained with pride. Ofthe people living in Easton only 2 are employees of the estate.
